FacilityName: Farmers Union Oil of Southern Valley, Breckenridge
ParentCompanyName: Farmers Union Oil of Southern Valley, Fairmount
OperatorName: Farmers Union Oil of Southern Valle
FRS_Method: GPS CARRIER PHASE STATIC RELATIVE POSITION

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
September 9, 2010

Farmers Union Oil of Southern Valley
Breckenridge Anhydrous Ammonia Plant
PO Box 153
Fairmount, North Dakota 58030

The board of directors, management, and employees of Farmers Union Oil of Southern Valley are committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia.  If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the Fairmount Fire Department, or other authorities, to mi minimize the impact of the release to people and the environment.  Farmers Union Oil of southern Valley has sponsored several NH3 safety trainings for the local fire department and the district fire departments in the last three years.

The primary activity at the facility is the storage of anhydrous ammonia and loading nurse tanks for delivery to the farm for application. 

Anhydrous ammonia is received, stored, and distributed for direct application for crop nutrients.

The maximum quantity stored would be 78,795 lbs. in one 18,000 gallon tank.  The maximum quantity handled would be the unloading of a transport truck vessel containing 53,000 pounds.

The worst case scenario would be the release of the total contents of a storage tank release over ten minutes.  The maximum quantity would be 78,795 pounds representing 85 percent of the largest tank capacity, as limited by design standards.   

The alternate release scenario based on a two minute release is a release from a break in a three inch transfer hose.  The distance to the endpoint in this case would be .62 miles.

The facility has implemented the provisions of "Safety Requirements for the Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia, K-61.1", published by The American National Standards Institute, Inc. and the standards of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA),29 CFR 1910.111, "Storage and handling of anhydrous ammonia".

There have been no accidental releases of Anhydrous Ammonia in the past five years at this site.

Farmers Union Oil of Southern Valle

y has a written action plan, in accordance with OSHA Standard 29 CFR 1910.38; provided state and local authorities with emergency planning and community right-to-know information as required under SARA Title III (EPRCA).

Farmers Union Oil of Southern Valley will coordinate this plan with the local emergency responders.

Safety improvement is an on-going process at the facility.  Periodic evaluations are performed to access the maintenance of safety conditions.  There are no additional specific anhydrous ammonia safety recommendations for implementations at this time.

Farmers Union Oil of Southern Valley has reviewed their safety policy on anhydrous ammonia annually and has a specific training before each fall application starts.  The company has several employees on the local fire department which makes the information and fire drill practices at this site happen more often.
